block.comment: This should report `True` on correct implementations.

block-definition.s: Go to coordinates %'coordinates' in board display
draw %'object' at row %'row' , col %'col' on board display

custom-block.s: Go to coordinates %l in board display

scripts.comment: Use the blocks to the right to implement finish move

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

custom-block.l: Click board to create bug. Move with arrow keys.

block-definition.comment: “Given a square-board of size N, represented as a 2D list, outputs a 1D list representing the board in row-major order. I.e.: the first N items of the list will be the entries in row 1. The next N items will be the entries in row 2, and so on. See the image in the spec for reference.”

block.comment: This should report `True` on correct implementations.

block-definition.comment: “Given a square-board of size N, represented as a 2D list, outputs a 1D list representing the board in column-major order. I.e.: the first N items of the list will be the entries in column 1, across all rows. The next N items will be the entries in column 2, across all rows, and so on. See the image in the spec for reference.”

block.comment: This should report `True` on correct implementations.

custom-block.s: Go to coordinates %l in board display
